newsitem.title: USA: US late spot gasoline takes beating, heat edges up.
newsitem.headline: US late spot gasoline takes beating, heat edges up.

text.p: U.S. spot gasoline took a drubbing by late Monday as heat edged marginally higher tracking NYMEX futures ahead of the expiry of the October products' contracts at today's close, traders said.
Most gasoline grades fell between 1.65 cents and 1.85 cents in both centers amid narrowly mixed differentials, players said, erasing every bit of Friday's strong gains.
Many traders last week predicted gasoline might continue to benefit from the continuing switchover by refiners from gasoline to maximum distillate production ahead of winter.
"It didn't happen today and I don't expect much of a dead-cat bounce tomorrow," one East Coast trader said, adding gasoline would be lucky to hold its own.
Traders also blamed gasoline's softness on perceptions that inventories are more-than-adequate, particularly since the peak demand season has past.
Prompt New York Harbor A4-grade reformulated gasoline was was pegged 1.10 cents below October futures, with November material talked at 1.25 cents under -- stable with Friday.
Heating oil was stable in both centers amid steady diffs and slighty firmer October futures, traders said.
-- Ransdell Pierson, New York Energy Desk 212 859-1632
